column5: Found this today on the web I've tried to find stuff on the Toronto Tomahawks from 1974 the only year they played in the league they were sold to Long Island but moved to Boston called the Bolts My Dad didn't go he stayed With Brampton excelsiors as captain http://wampsbibleoflacrosse.com/newstats/1974nllpro.txt He was Inducted into the Lacrosse Hall Fame in St Catherines in 1998 And the Brampton Sports Hall of Fame for Lacrosse and Curling in 2011 Yes I'm proud of my dad BTW his Name is Bob Haw
Thats pretty cool man! My buddys uncle played for the rock for a long time, he either used to or still does hold the record for loose balls which always made me laugh.
I played with scoop (Veltman) in minor lacrosse in Brampton his brother John  too

Awesome to see your report!  You must be very proud of your father playing along side such greats as Bob McCready, Gaylord Powless.  A high school friend of mine (John Mouradian) also played lacrosse in that era.  He played with the Buffalo Bandits, played & also coached the Toronto Rock.  Last news I heard of Johnny was he was in Phoenix as part owner, general manager.    Do you know of his whereabouts?
Ya veltman thats it! I know a lot of the family they are good people.

That's pretty cool, Rodbender.  I wonder if I ever watched your Dad play.  I used to watch Pro Lacrosse when I was a kid at that time.  It used to be televised, but I think the name of the team was the Toronto Shooting Stars, not the Tomahawks.
